instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2390: What is 820-2390? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.ISL6258: What is ISL6258? This is a charging chip for Macbook motherboards from 2008 through 2009.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H: What is PPDCIN_G3H? PPDCIN_G3H Is a power rail that comes directly from the laptop charger..
definitions.C7771: What is C7771? Tantalum capacitor on 820-2330 and 820-2532 logic boards that often dies and causes PP1V05_S5_MCP or PP1V05_S5 to be 0.331v instead of 1.05v. If heating this cap restores voltage to this rail, replace.
definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2390</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light, not booting after water damage.
threads.message:
Hi, 

Got this old board with some whater damage near CPU area. There is no green light. Fans spin with SMC BYPASS but no image no sound not booting. 


Getting this values on main rails: 


<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>  8.41V 

<SIGNAL>PPBUS_CPU_IMVP_ISNS</SIGNAL> 8.41V

<SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H</SIGNAL> 17.04V

<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> 3.42V 

<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL> 3.3V



The only thing i noticed it that on <CHIP>U7000</CHIP>  the resistance between 27/28 is 21.9 and 17/18 is 21.5 too. I know for ISL 6529 second value mst be about 3ohm but seems that this one (<CHIP>ISL6258</CHIP>...) is 21 both. ANyway changed it and same things happening. 


Any suggestion?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2390</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light, not booting after water damage.
threads.message:
Do you get correct voltage at <CAPACITOR>C7771</CAPACITOR>?
Don't forget to check it, before sending the machine out to the client.

Check current and voltage sensing circuits from page 45.
<CHIP>U7000</CHIP>, pins 17/18 have correct 20 ohms, as per schematic.
Inspect for corroded traces/resistors under microscope around affected areas.

When in SMC bypass, do you get voltage at all big coils?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2390</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light, not booting after water damage.
threads.message:
getting 1.1V pm <CAPACITOR>C7771</CAPACITOR>. This was first i checked. 


There is no visible corrosion except of  <CAPACITOR>C7115</CAPACITOR> and a couple of near components. Anyway will try to clean one more time in ultrasonic and back once finish. THanks.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2390</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light, not booting after water damage.
threads.message:
Ultrasonic bath can clean corrosion, but will not rebuild broken traces.
You have a problem with some I/V sensor; like <SIGNAL>PBUS_VSENSE</SIGNAL>, or other from mentioned page.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2390</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light, not booting after water damage.
threads.message:
When smcbypass i am getting.

L7100/01 0.9V


CPU and both GPU are heating.


I have checked whole board and cannot find anything.


Also from page 45


<SIGNAL>PBUSVSENS_EN</SIGNAL> 0V is that normal?


<TRANSISTOR>Q5315</TRANSISTOR>

4 - 8.40
5 - 8.30
6 - 8.25

3 and 2 0V



About PPBUS 8.4 is that normal? Does it likes <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> that mean smc issue?




And CPU Vcore side sensor: 

<CHIP>U5388</CHIP> (seems be ok)

Pins 4-5-6 8.4V
Pin 3 3.4V




P.S: <SIGNAL>IMVP6_IMON</SIGNAL> must be 0?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2390</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light, not booting after water damage.
threads.message: Also i am checking 1 wire and on <RESISTOR>R6912</RESISTOR> getting 6V on pin 1 and 0 on pin 2. Resistance is ok 330KOhms,

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2390</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light, not booting after water damage.
threads.message:
You cannot have more than 3.3V at <CHIP>U5388</CHIP> output, unless it is bad!
Its output is related with voltage drop across <RESISTOR>R5388</RESISTOR>.
For example, 5A will generate 2.5V at <CAPACITOR>C5335</CAPACITOR>.
When board is off, you should have 0V there...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2390</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light, not booting after water damage.
threads.message:
sorry, it's 0V all other measerements are ok. 

About ppbus 8.4 and one - wire circuit any wrong thing? 


also why i am getting this: "Also i am checking 1 wire and on <RESISTOR>R6912</RESISTOR> getting 6V on pin 1 and 0 on pin 2. Resistance is ok 330KOhms,"


Thank you

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2390</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light, not booting after water damage.
threads.message:
Nothing wrong with <RESISTOR>R6912</RESISTOR>, it has correct voltages.
Usually <CHIP>U6915</CHIP> is the "bad guy" there; but <TRANSISTOR>Q6910</TRANSISTOR> fails too.
Post their voltages...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2390</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light, not booting after water damage.
threads.message:
Finally i replaced <CHIP>U6915</CHIP>, <TRANSISTOR>Q6915</TRANSISTOR>,<TRANSISTOR>Q6910</TRANSISTOR>, <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> (again) and many other and now computer starts. The only problem still remains is that its not charging. No green light. It detects magsafe because battery in status bar change status but not charging. 


Seems one wire issue but i cant find nothing more to replace.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2390</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light, not booting after water damage.
threads.message:
<CHIP>U6915</CHIP> was the problem. seems donor <CHIP>U6915</CHIP> was bad too. 

THank you very much

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2390</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> no green light, not booting after water damage.
threads.message:
You don't need to change so many components.
Just read their voltages and interpret the values...
